snippet: Without defections, the Syrian rebels say the opposition cannot hope to grow, never mind prevail in its battle with the government of President Bashar al-Assad.
abstract: Opposition commanders say defections from Syrian military have slowed to a trickle; Free Syrian Army has relied on defectors to lead a credible challenge to Pres Bashar al-Assad.

byline.original: By KAREEM FAHIM and HWAIDA SAAD
byline.contributor: Hania Mourtada contributed reporting from Beirut, Lebanon.

lead_paragraph: Without defections, the Syrian rebels say the opposition cannot hope to grow, never mind prevail in its battle with the government of President Bashar al-Assad.

headline.seo: Syria Rebels Press Harder to Gain More Fighters
headline.main: Cajoling, Drugging and More as Rebels Try to Draw Defectors
headline.print_headline: Cajoling, Drugging And More as Rebels Try to Draw Defectors

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
